Citation.sAbstract: The solid-liquid equilibrium of the quaternary system + + 2 4 2 Na ,K / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { and its subsystem + 2 4 2 Na / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { , + 2 4 2 K / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { , + + 2 4 2 Na ,K / /HPO H O { { at 298.2K was investigated by the isothermal solution saturation method. The solubility of salts and the equilibrium solid phases were determined. The ternary phase diagram, quaternary dry-salt phase diagram and the water-content diagram were constructed. There is one invariant point, two univariant curves and four crystallization regions in the ternary system + 2 4 2 Na / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { and + 2 4 2 K / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { . The ternary system + + 2 4 2 Na ,K / /HPO H O { { contains two invariant points, three univariant curves and six crystallization regions. The quaternary system + + 2 4 2 Na ,K / /HPO ,Cl H O { { { contains three invariant points, seven univariant curves and five crystallization regions corresponding to KCl, NaCl, Na2HPO4!P12H2O, Na2HPO4!P7H2O and K2HPO4!P3H2O. In the quaternary system, KCl occupies the largest crystallization region while K2HPO4.3H2O crystallization region is the smallest. Three kinds of hydrated salts were found in the system while there is no double salts or solid solution. HPO4 2- is the main factor that affects the relative water content in the liquid phase. All the data and results obtained in this paper are of great significance to the crystallization technology of K2HPO4 and the new production process of KH2PO4.
Citation.sTitle: Solid-Liquid Equilibria in the Quaternary System Na+,K+//HPO42-,Cl--H2O and Its Subsystems Na+//HPO42-,Cl--H2O, K+//HPO42-,Cl--H2O, and Na+,K+//HPO42--H2O at 298.2 K
